trans-unit.source: Put string resources for your UI into resource files.
trans-unit.target: Put string resources for your UI into resource files.

trans-unit.source: You can then reference those strings from your code or markup.
trans-unit.target: You can then reference those strings from your code or markup.

trans-unit.source: Put UI strings into resources
trans-unit.target: Put UI strings into resources

trans-unit.target: Put UI strings into resources

trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceLoader
trans-unit.target: ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceLoader

trans-unit.source: WinJS.Resources.processAll
trans-unit.target: WinJS.Resources.processAll

trans-unit.source: Put string resources for your UI into resource files.
trans-unit.target: Put string resources for your UI into resource files.

trans-unit.source: You can then reference those strings from your code or markup.
trans-unit.target: You can then reference those strings from your code or markup.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows the steps to add several language string resources to your Universal Windows app, and how to briefly test it.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows the steps to add several language string resources to your Universal Windows app, and how to briefly test it.

trans-unit.source: Put strings into resource files, instead of putting them directly in code or markup.
trans-unit.target: Put strings into resource files, instead of putting them directly in code or markup.

trans-unit.source: Open your solution (or create a new one) in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open your solution (or create a new one) in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Open package.appxmanifest in Visual Studio, go to the **Application** tab, and (for this example) set the Default language to "en-US".
trans-unit.target: Open package.appxmanifest in Visual Studio, go to the **Application** tab, and (for this example) set the Default language to "en-US".

trans-unit.source: If there are multiple package.appxmanifest files in your solution, do this for each one.
trans-unit.target: If there are multiple package.appxmanifest files in your solution, do this for each one.

trans-unit.source: **Note** This specifies the default language for the project.
trans-unit.target: **Note** This specifies the default language for the project.

trans-unit.source: The default language resources are used if the user's preferred language or display languages do not match the language resources provided in the application.
trans-unit.target: The default language resources are used if the user's preferred language or display languages do not match the language resources provided in the application.

trans-unit.source: Create a folder to contain the resource files.
trans-unit.target: Create a folder to contain the resource files.

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer, right-click the project (the Shared project if your solution contains multiple projects) and select **Add** > **New Folder**.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer, right-click the project (the Shared project if your solution contains multiple projects) and select **Add** > **New Folder**.

trans-unit.source: Name the new folder "Strings".
trans-unit.target: Name the new folder "Strings".

trans-unit.source: If the new folder is not visible in Solution Explorer, select **Project** > **Show All Files** from the Microsoft Visual Studio menu while the project is still selected.
trans-unit.target: If the new folder is not visible in Solution Explorer, select **Project** > **Show All Files** from the Microsoft Visual Studio menu while the project is still selected.

trans-unit.source: Create a sub-folder and a resource file for English (United States).
trans-unit.target: Create a sub-folder and a resource file for English (United States).

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Strings folder and add a new folder beneath it.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Strings folder and add a new folder beneath it.

trans-unit.source: Name it "en-US".
trans-unit.target: Name it "en-US".

trans-unit.source: The resource file is to be placed in a folder that has been named for the [BCP-47](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=227302) language tag.
trans-unit.target: The resource file is to be placed in a folder that has been named for the [BCP-47](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=227302) language tag.

trans-unit.source: See [How to name resources using qualifiers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh965324) for details on the language qualifier and a list of common language tags.
trans-unit.target: See [How to name resources using qualifiers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh965324) for details on the language qualifier and a list of common language tags.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the en-US folder and select **Add** > **New Item…**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the en-US folder and select **Add** > **New Item…**.

trans-unit.source: **XAML:** Select "Resources File (.resw)".
trans-unit.target: **XAML:** Select "Resources File (.resw)".

trans-unit.source: **HTML:** Select "Resources File (.resjson)".
trans-unit.target: **HTML:** Select "Resources File (.resjson)".

trans-unit.source: Click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: This adds a resource file with the default name "Resources.resw" (for **XAML**) or "resources.rejson" (for **HTML**).
trans-unit.target: This adds a resource file with the default name "Resources.resw" (for **XAML**) or "resources.rejson" (for **HTML**).

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you use this default filename.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you use this default filename.

trans-unit.source: Apps can partition their resources into other files, but you must be careful to refer to them correctly (see [How to load string resources](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh965323)).
trans-unit.target: Apps can partition their resources into other files, but you must be careful to refer to them correctly (see [How to load string resources](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh965323)).

trans-unit.source: **XAML only:** If you have .resx files with only string resources from previous .NET projects, select **Add** > **Existing Item…**, add the .resx file, and rename it to .resw.
trans-unit.target: **XAML only:** If you have .resx files with only string resources from previous .NET projects, select **Add** > **Existing Item…**, add the .resx file, and rename it to .resw.

trans-unit.source: Open the file and use the editor to add these resources:
trans-unit.target: Open the file and use the editor to add these resources:

trans-unit.source: XAML:
trans-unit.target: XAML:

trans-unit.source: Strings/en-US/Resources.resw ![add resource, english](images/addresource-en-us.png) In this example, "Greeting.Text" and "Farewell" identify the strings that are to be displayed.
trans-unit.target: Strings/en-US/Resources.resw ![add resource, english](images/addresource-en-us.png) In this example, "Greeting.Text" and "Farewell" identify the strings that are to be displayed.

trans-unit.source: "Greeting.Width" identifies the Width property of the "Greeting" string.
trans-unit.target: "Greeting.Width" identifies the Width property of the "Greeting" string.

trans-unit.source: The comments are a good place to provide any special instructions to translators who localize the strings to other languages.
trans-unit.target: The comments are a good place to provide any special instructions to translators who localize the strings to other languages.

trans-unit.source: HTML:
trans-unit.target: HTML:

trans-unit.source: The new file contains default content.
trans-unit.target: The new file contains default content.

trans-unit.source: Replace the content with the following (which may be similar to the default):
trans-unit.target: Replace the content with the following (which may be similar to the default):

trans-unit.source: Strings/en-US/resources.resjson
trans-unit.target: Strings/en-US/resources.resjson

trans-unit.source: This is strict JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) syntax where a comma must be placed after each name/value pair, except the last one.
trans-unit.target: This is strict JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) syntax where a comma must be placed after each name/value pair, except the last one.

trans-unit.source: In this sample, "greeting" and "farewell" identify the strings that are to be displayed.
trans-unit.target: In this sample, "greeting" and "farewell" identify the strings that are to be displayed.

trans-unit.source: The other pairs ("\_greeting.comment" and "\_farewell.comment") are comments that describe the strings.
trans-unit.target: The other pairs ("\_greeting.comment" and "\_farewell.comment") are comments that describe the strings.

trans-unit.source: The comments are a good place to provide any special instructions to translators who localize the strings to other languages.
trans-unit.target: The comments are a good place to provide any special instructions to translators who localize the strings to other languages.

trans-unit.source: Associate controls to resources.
trans-unit.target: Associate controls to resources.

trans-unit.source: XAML only:
trans-unit.target: XAML only:

trans-unit.source: You need to associate every control that needs localized text with the .resw file.
trans-unit.target: You need to associate every control that needs localized text with the .resw file.

trans-unit.source: You do this using the **x:Uid** attribute on your XAML elements like this:
trans-unit.target: You do this using the **x:Uid** attribute on your XAML elements like this:

trans-unit.source: For the resource name, you give the **Uid** attribute value, plus you specify what property is to get the translated string (in this case the Text property).
trans-unit.target: For the resource name, you give the **Uid** attribute value, plus you specify what property is to get the translated string (in this case the Text property).

trans-unit.source: You can specify other properties/values for different languages such as Greeting.Width, but be careful with such layout-related properties.
trans-unit.target: You can specify other properties/values for different languages such as Greeting.Width, but be careful with such layout-related properties.

trans-unit.source: You should strive to allow the controls to lay out dynamically based on the device's screen.
trans-unit.target: You should strive to allow the controls to lay out dynamically based on the device's screen.

trans-unit.source: Note that attached properties are handled differently in resw files such as AutomationPeer.Name.
trans-unit.target: Note that attached properties are handled differently in resw files such as AutomationPeer.Name.

trans-unit.source: You need to explicitly write out the namespace like this:
trans-unit.target: You need to explicitly write out the namespace like this:

trans-unit.source: Add string resource identifiers to code and markup.
trans-unit.target: Add string resource identifiers to code and markup.

trans-unit.source: XAML:
trans-unit.target: XAML:

trans-unit.source: In your code, you can dynamically reference strings:
trans-unit.target: In your code, you can dynamically reference strings:

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: HTML:
trans-unit.target: HTML:

trans-unit.source: Add references to the Windows Library for JavaScript to your HTML file, if they aren't already there.
trans-unit.target: Add references to the Windows Library for JavaScript to your HTML file, if they aren't already there.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The following code shows the HTML for the default.html file of the Windows project that is generated when you create a new **Blank App (Universal Windows)** JavaScript project in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The following code shows the HTML for the default.html file of the Windows project that is generated when you create a new **Blank App (Universal Windows)** JavaScript project in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Note that the file already contains references to the WinJS.
trans-unit.target: Note that the file already contains references to the WinJS.

trans-unit.source: In the JavaScript code that accompanies your HTML file, call the [**WinJS.Resources.processAll**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211864) function when your HTML is loaded.
trans-unit.target: In the JavaScript code that accompanies your HTML file, call the [**WinJS.Resources.processAll**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211864) function when your HTML is loaded.

trans-unit.source: If additional HTML is loaded into a [**WinJS.UI.Pages.PageControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj126158) object, call [**WinJS.Resources.processAll**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211864)(*element*) in the page control's [**IPageControlMembers.ready**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh770590) method, where *element* is the HTML element (and its child elements) being loaded.
trans-unit.target: If additional HTML is loaded into a [**WinJS.UI.Pages.PageControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj126158) object, call [**WinJS.Resources.processAll**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211864)(*element*) in the page control's [**IPageControlMembers.ready**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh770590) method, where *element* is the HTML element (and its child elements) being loaded.

trans-unit.source: This example is based on scenario 6 of the [Application resources and localization sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=227301):
trans-unit.target: This example is based on scenario 6 of the [Application resources and localization sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=227301):

trans-unit.source: In the HTML, refer to the string resources using the resource identifiers ('greeting' and 'farewell') from the resource files.
trans-unit.target: In the HTML, refer to the string resources using the resource identifiers ('greeting' and 'farewell') from the resource files.

trans-unit.source: Refer to string resources for attributes.
trans-unit.target: Refer to string resources for attributes.

trans-unit.source: The general pattern of the data-win-res attribute for HTML replacement is data-win-res="{*propertyname1*: '*resource ID*', *propertyname2*: '*resource ID2*'}".
trans-unit.target: The general pattern of the data-win-res attribute for HTML replacement is data-win-res="{*propertyname1*: '*resource ID*', *propertyname2*: '*resource ID2*'}".

trans-unit.source: **Note** If the string does not contain any markup, then bind the resource wherever possible to the textContent property instead of innerHTML.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If the string does not contain any markup, then bind the resource wherever possible to the textContent property instead of innerHTML.

trans-unit.source: The textContent property is much faster to replace than innerHTML.
trans-unit.target: The textContent property is much faster to replace than innerHTML.

trans-unit.source: Refer to string resources in JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: Refer to string resources in JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: Add folders and resource files for two additional languages.
trans-unit.target: Add folders and resource files for two additional languages.

trans-unit.source: Add another folder under the Strings folder for German.
trans-unit.target: Add another folder under the Strings folder for German.

trans-unit.source: Name the folder "de-DE" for Deutsch (Deutschland).
trans-unit.target: Name the folder "de-DE" for Deutsch (Deutschland).

trans-unit.source: Create another resources file in the de-DE folder, and add the following:
trans-unit.target: Create another resources file in the de-DE folder, and add the following:

trans-unit.source: XAML:
trans-unit.target: XAML:

trans-unit.source: strings/de-DE/Resources.resw
trans-unit.target: strings/de-DE/Resources.resw

trans-unit.source: add resource, german
trans-unit.target: add resource, german

trans-unit.source: HTML:
trans-unit.target: HTML:

trans-unit.source: strings/de-DE/resources.resjson
trans-unit.target: strings/de-DE/resources.resjson

trans-unit.source: Create one more folder named "fr-FR", for français (France).
trans-unit.target: Create one more folder named "fr-FR", for français (France).

trans-unit.source: Create a new resources file and add the following:
trans-unit.target: Create a new resources file and add the following:

trans-unit.source: XAML:
trans-unit.target: XAML:

trans-unit.source: strings/fr-FR/Resources.resw ![add resource, french](images/addresource-fr-fr.png) **HTML:**
trans-unit.target: strings/fr-FR/Resources.resw ![add resource, french](images/addresource-fr-fr.png) **HTML:**

trans-unit.source: strings/fr-FR/resources.resjson
trans-unit.target: strings/fr-FR/resources.resjson

trans-unit.source: Build and run the app.
trans-unit.target: Build and run the app.

trans-unit.source: Test the app for your default display language.
trans-unit.target: Test the app for your default display language.

trans-unit.source: Press F5 to build and run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press F5 to build and run the app.

trans-unit.source: Note that the greeting and farewell are displayed in the user's preferred language.
trans-unit.target: Note that the greeting and farewell are displayed in the user's preferred language.

trans-unit.source: Exit the app.
trans-unit.target: Exit the app.

trans-unit.source: Test the app for the other languages.
trans-unit.target: Test the app for the other languages.

trans-unit.source: Bring up **Settings** on your device.
trans-unit.target: Bring up **Settings** on your device.

trans-unit.source: Select **Time & language**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Time & language**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Region & language** (or on a phone or phone emulator, **Language**).
trans-unit.target: Select **Region & language** (or on a phone or phone emulator, **Language**).

trans-unit.source: Note that the language that was displayed when you ran the app is the top language listed that is English, German, or French.
trans-unit.target: Note that the language that was displayed when you ran the app is the top language listed that is English, German, or French.

trans-unit.source: If your top language is not one of these three, the app falls back to the next one on the list that the app supports.
trans-unit.target: If your top language is not one of these three, the app falls back to the next one on the list that the app supports.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have all three of these languages on your machine, add the missing ones by clicking **Add a language** and adding them to the list.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have all three of these languages on your machine, add the missing ones by clicking **Add a language** and adding them to the list.

trans-unit.source: To test the app with another language, select the language in the list and click **Set as default** (or on a phone or phone emulator, tap and hold the language in the list and then tap **Move up** until it is at the top).
trans-unit.target: To test the app with another language, select the language in the list and click **Set as default** (or on a phone or phone emulator, tap and hold the language in the list and then tap **Move up** until it is at the top).

trans-unit.source: Then run the app.
trans-unit.target: Then run the app.
